00022 /// @file   apt-convert-spf.cpp
00023 /// @brief  Converts an spf file from one SPF format to another.  Reformats DMET SPF files.
00024 
00025 //
00026 #include "chipstream/ProbeListFactory.h"
00027 #include "chipstream/ProbeListStl.h"
00028 //

00031 #include "util/Err.h"

00048 /// @brief     Convert an spf from one format to another.
00049 /// @param     spf_i_name
00050 /// @param     spf_o_name
00051 /// @param     spf_o_format
00052 /// @param     extra_columns
00053 void apt_convert_spf(const std::string& spf_i_name,
00054                      const std::string& spf_o_name,
00055                      int spf_o_format,
00056                      int extra_columns
00057                      )
00058 {
00059   printf("apt-convert-spf: '%s' => '%s' (fmt=%d)\n",
00060          spf_i_name.c_str(),
00061          spf_o_name.c_str(),
00062          spf_o_format);
00063   //
00064   ProbeListFactory* plf=new ProbeListFactory();
00065   affx::SpfFile spf_i;
00066   affx::SpfFile spf_o;
00067 
00068   spf_i.openSpf(spf_i_name);
00069   plf->readSpfFile(spf_i);
00070   spf_i.close();
00071 
00072   //
00073   spf_o.addHeadersFrom(spf_i,affx::TSV_ADD_ALL);
00074   //
00075   spf_o.m_has_allele_info=extra_columns;
00076   spf_o.m_has_context_info=extra_columns;
00077   spf_o.m_has_channel_info=extra_columns;
00078   //
00079   spf_o.writeSpf(spf_o_name,spf_o_format);
00080   plf->writeToSpfFile(spf_o);
00081   //
00082   delete plf;
00083 }
00084

00087 /// A handy macro.
00088 #define PRINT_PS_CNT(_lbl,_plf) {                                             \
00089     std::string tmp_str=_lbl;                                           \
00090     printf("%s psCount=%d\n",tmp_str.c_str(),_plf->getProbeSetCount()); \
00091   }
00092 
00093 ProbeListFactory*
00094 apt_falcon_merge_spf2plf(const std::string& spf_i_name)
00095 {
00096   ProbeListFactory* plf=new ProbeListFactory();
00097   plf->readSpfFile(spf_i_name);
00098   PRINT_PS_CNT("read probes from '"+spf_i_name+"'",plf);
00099   //
00100   // printf("dump:start: '%s'\n",spf_i_name.c_str());
00101   // plf->dump();
00102   // printf("dump:end: '%s'\n",spf_i_name.c_str());
00103   //
00104   return plf;
00105 }

00107 void
00108 apt_falcon_merge_chiptype(ProbeListFactory* plf_out,
00109                           ProbeListFactory* plf_from)
00110 {
00111   plf_out->m_chipTypes   = plf_from->m_chipTypes;
00112   plf_out->m_numCols     = plf_from->m_numCols;
00113   plf_out->m_numRows     = plf_from->m_numRows;
00114   plf_out->m_numChannels = plf_from->m_numChannels;
00115 }
00116 
00117 // A simple concat of the input Factory to the output Factory.
00118 void
00119 apt_falcon_merge_plf2plf(ProbeListFactory* plf_to,
00120                          ProbeListFactory* plf_from,
00121                          int chan)
00122 {
00123   ProbeListStl pl_tmp;
00124   //
00125   for (int i=0;i<plf_from->getProbeSetCount();i++) {
00126     pl_tmp=plf_from->getProbeListAtIndex(i);
00127     // set the channel
00128     for (int b=0;b<pl_tmp.block_cnt();b++) {
00129       pl_tmp.set_blockChannel(b,chan);
00130     }
00131     //
00132     plf_to->add_ProbeList(pl_tmp);
00133   }
00134 }
00135 
00136 // How to do the mapping.
00137 //
00138 // * NonAS
00139 //
00140 //   5298423AC_r 1 1 5 0 1 5 1502317,1502569,1502066,1503094,1502830
00141 //     This is mono-morphic. (we think)
00142 //     G will ask Therea
00143 //     
00144 //   snp_rs2820041_0w_r 1 1 6 0 1 6 689782,688627,688019,678473,313521,687601
00145 //     Goes on both channels. (0 and 1)
00146 //
00147 //   snp_rs27908_0w_f 1 1 6 0 1 6 1255986,1255761,882153,1256244,1255478,1255186
00148 //   snp_rs27908_1wa0_r 1 1 6 0 1 6 492244,867320,867782,867007,867514,866742
00149 //   snp_rs27908_1wa1_r 1 1 6 0 1 6 492243,866741,867781,867319,867513,867008
00150 //     Do not merge (a0 and a1) into a single probeset.
00151 //     Instead treat as above.  Put on both channels.
00152 //     (This makes for 3 probesets.)
00153 //   
00154 //   indel_rs1182182_0w_f
00155 //     These may only be in the NonAS file
00156 //
00157 // * AS (AT/GC)
00158 // 
00159 //   snp_rs10000235_0w_r-A      1       1       3       0       1       3       84962,97117,66491
00160 //   snp_rs10000235_0w_r-B      1       1       3       0       1       3       83474,95629,67979
00161 //     merge into one probeset "snp_rs10000235_0w_r" 
00162 //     A and B go to same channel based on filename
00163 //   
00164 //   The "-A" or "-B" is required.
00165 //
00166 
00167 // Constuct the RE only once.
00168 pcrecpp::RE getTypeFromName_Marker_re("^(snp|indel|snpind)_");
00169 
00170 int getTypeFromName(const std::string& ps_name)
00171 {
00172   // Does this name look like a Marker name?
00173   if (getTypeFromName_Marker_re.PartialMatch(ps_name)) {
00174     // yep.
00175     return affxcdf::MarkerProbeSetType;
00176   }
00177   // nope.
00178   return affxcdf::UnknownProbeSetType;
00179 }
00180 
00181 /// put the nonas probes on both channels.
00182 void
00183 apt_falcon_merge_plf2plf_nonas(ProbeListFactory* plf_out,
00184                                ProbeListFactory* plf_from)
00185 {
00186   ProbeListStl pls_orig;
00187   ProbeListStl pls_out;
00188   std::string match_name;
00189 
00190   for (int idx=0;idx<plf_from->getProbeSetCount();idx++) {
00191     pls_orig.clear();
00192     pls_out.clear();
00193 
00194     //
00195     pls_orig=plf_from->getProbeListAtIndex(idx);
00196     APT_ERR_ASSERT(pls_orig.block_cnt()==1,"Only one block allowed per probeset in input. "+
00197                    ToStr(pls_orig.get_name())+" has "+ToStr(pls_orig.block_cnt())+".");
00198 
00199     // init output ProbeList based on input.
00200     pls_out.set_name(pls_orig.get_name());
00201     // type
00202     pls_out.set_type(getTypeFromName(pls_out.get_name()));
00203     // force to "1"
00204     pls_out.set_numMatch(1);
00205 
00206     // make a copy for each channel.
00207     // block 0 always A=0,C=1
00208     pls_orig.set_blockAllele(0,0);
00209     pls_orig.set_blockContext(0,0); // always 0
00210     pls_orig.set_blockChannel(0,1);
00211     pls_out.push_probelist(pls_orig); // push modified block as first block on output.
00212     // block 1 always A=1,C=0
00213     pls_orig.set_blockAllele(0,1);
00214     pls_orig.set_blockContext(0,0);
00215     pls_orig.set_blockChannel(0,0);
00216     pls_out.push_probelist(pls_orig); // push modified block as second block on output
00217     //
00218     plf_out->add_ProbeList(pls_out);
00219   }
00220 }
00221 
00222 void
00223 apt_falcon_merge_plf2plf_AB(ProbeListFactory* plf_to,
00224                             ProbeListFactory* plf_from,
00225                             const int channel_to)
00226 {
00227   //const int warn_max=50;
00228   //int warn_count=0;
00229   //
00230   std::string match_name;
00231   std::string match_allele_ab;
00232   int match_allele;
00233   //int match_context;
00234   std::string match_dir;
00235   //
00236   std::string out_name;
00237   //
00238   ProbeListStl pls;
00239   //
00240   std::map<std::string,ProbeListStl> name2pls_map;
00241   std::map<std::string,ProbeListStl>::iterator name2pl_map_iter;
00242   std::map<std::string,ProbeListStl>::iterator iter;
00243 
00244   // A  "^...$" is implied by FullMatch()
00245   pcrecpp::RE allele_AB_re("(.*)-([AB])");
00246 
00247   //
00248   for (int idx=0;idx<plf_from->getProbeSetCount();idx++) {
00249     //
00250     match_name="";
00251     match_allele=-1;
00252     match_dir="";
00253     //
00254     pls=plf_from->getProbeListAtIndex(idx);
00255     //
00256     if (allele_AB_re.FullMatch(pls.get_name_string(),
00257                                &match_name,
00258                                &match_allele_ab)) {
00259       out_name=match_name;
00260       if (match_allele_ab=="A") {
00261         match_allele=0;
00262       }
00263       else if (match_allele_ab=="B") {
00264         match_allele=1;
00265       }
00266       else {
00267         APT_ERR_ABORT("Probeset name does not end with 'A' or 'B'.");
00268       }
00269     }
00270     else {
00271       APT_ERR_ABORT("Probeset name does match RE.");
00272     }
00273 
00274     // look it up.
00275     iter=name2pls_map.find(out_name);
00276     if (iter==name2pls_map.end()) {
00277       std::pair<std::map<std::string,ProbeListStl>::iterator,bool> rv;
00278       rv=name2pls_map.insert(std::pair<std::string,ProbeListStl>(out_name,ProbeListStl()));
00279       iter=rv.first;
00280       iter->second.set_name(out_name);
00281       iter->second.set_type(getTypeFromName(out_name));
00282       // force to "1"
00283       iter->second.set_numMatch(1);
00284     }
00285     // the probeset we are about to merge may only have one block.
00286     // (We could do more, but that is all we want to for now.)
00287     APT_ERR_ASSERT(pls.block_cnt()==1,"May only have one block. Index="+ToStr(idx));
00288     // it should also have the same numMatch as what it is being merged with.
00289     // (No merging a pm/mm with a pm-only probeset!)
00290     APT_ERR_ASSERT(pls.get_numMatch()==iter->second.get_numMatch(),"mismatch in numMatch!");
00291     //
00292     // pls is what is about to be pushed.
00293     pls.set_blockAllele(0,match_allele);
00294     pls.set_blockContext(0,0);
00295     pls.set_blockChannel(0,channel_to);
00296     //
00297     iter->second.push_probelist(pls);
00298   }
00299 
00300  // put the merged probesets into the output ProbeListFactory
00301   for (std::map<std::string,ProbeListStl>::iterator iter=name2pls_map.begin();iter!=name2pls_map.end();iter++) {
00302     ProbeListStl* pls=&iter->second;
00303     if (pls->block_cnt()!=2) {
00304       printf("WARNING: probeset '%s' has %d blocks.\n",pls->get_name_cstr(),pls->block_cnt());
00305       pls->dump();
00306     }
00307     // make sure the blocks are in the correct order.  (A then B)
00308     APT_ERR_ASSERT(pls->get_blockAllele(0)==0,"Block 0 is not allele 0.");
00309     APT_ERR_ASSERT(pls->get_blockAllele(1)==1,"Block 1 is not allele 1.");
00310     //
00311     plf_to->add_ProbeList(*pls);
00312   }
00313 }
00314 
00315 void
00316 apt_falcon_merge(const std::vector<std::string>& spf_i_nonas_name_vec,
00317                  const std::vector<std::string>& spf_i_at_name_vec,
00318                  const std::vector<std::string>& spf_i_gc_name_vec,
00319                  int change_probe_type,
00320                  bool do_sort,
00321                  //
00322                  const std::string& spf_o_name)
00323 {
00324   //
00325   //
00326   ProbeListFactory* plf_out=new ProbeListFactory();
00327   //
00328   std::vector<int> channel_vec;
00329 
00330   // nonas is on both channels.
00331   for (int i=0;i<spf_i_nonas_name_vec.size();i++) {
00332     ProbeListFactory* plf_nonas=apt_falcon_merge_spf2plf(spf_i_nonas_name_vec[i]);
00333     apt_falcon_merge_plf2plf_nonas(plf_out,plf_nonas);
00334     PRINT_PS_CNT("After adding nonas:",plf_out);
00335     //
00336     apt_falcon_merge_chiptype(plf_out,plf_nonas);
00337     delete plf_nonas;
00338   }
00339 
00340   // Map AT to channel 1
00341   for (int i=0;i<spf_i_at_name_vec.size();i++) {
00342     ProbeListFactory* plf_at=apt_falcon_merge_spf2plf(spf_i_at_name_vec[i]);
00343     apt_falcon_merge_plf2plf_AB(plf_out,plf_at,1);
00344     PRINT_PS_CNT("After adding AT:   ",plf_out);
00345     //
00346     apt_falcon_merge_chiptype(plf_out,plf_at);
00347     delete plf_at;
00348   }
00349 
00350   // Map GC to channel 0
00351   for (int i=0;i<spf_i_gc_name_vec.size();i++) {
00352     ProbeListFactory* plf_gc=apt_falcon_merge_spf2plf(spf_i_gc_name_vec[i]);
00353     apt_falcon_merge_plf2plf_AB(plf_out,plf_gc,0);
00354     PRINT_PS_CNT("After adding GT:   ",plf_out);
00355     //
00356     apt_falcon_merge_chiptype(plf_out,plf_gc);
00357     delete plf_gc;
00358   }
00359 
00360   // make it ordered for searching...
00361   if (do_sort) {
00362     printf("Sorting probesets by name...\n");
00363     plf_out->sortFactoryByName();
00364   }
00365 
00366   // do we want to change the probe type?
00367   if (change_probe_type!=-1) {
00368     for (int psi=0;psi<plf_out->getProbeSetCount();psi++) {
00369       plf_out->getProbeListAtIndex(psi).set_type(change_probe_type);
00370     }
00371   }
00372 
00373   // force the channel count to 2 as this is the whole point.
00374   plf_out->m_numChannels=2;
00375   // ...and write it to our new SpfFile
00376   printf("Writing to '%s'...\n",spf_o_name.c_str());
00377   plf_out->writeSpfFile(spf_o_name,4,1,1);
00378 
00379   //
00380   delete plf_out;
00381 }

00384 
00385 void define_apt_convert_spf_options(PgOptions* opts)
00386 {
00387   opts->setUsage("apt-convert-spf - Program for converting spf files.\n"
00388 "\n"
00389 "EXAMPLES: \n"
00390 "\n"
00391 "* To merge falcon spf files and assign the probes to channels:\n"
00392 "    apt-convert-spf \\\n"
00393 "            --output falcon-merged.spf \\\n"
00394 "            --merge-nonas HTFalconScreen01-nonAS_geno.spf \\\n"
00395 "            --merge-at HTFalconScreen01-norm_AS_HM_AT.spf \\\n"
00396 "            --merge-gc HTFalconScreen01-norm_AS_HM_GC.spf \\\n"
00397 "\n"
00398 "* To convert the format of an spf file:\n"
00399 "    apt-convert-spf -f v3 --output foo-v3.spf GenomeWideSNP_6.spf.small\n"
00400 
00401 "The Row x Col size is taken from the input Spfs.\n"
00402 "When --merge is used, num-channels is set to '2'.\n"
00403 "\n"
00404 );
00405   
00406   opts->defOpt("h", "help", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00407                      "Display program options short blurb on usage.",
00408                      "false");
00409   //
00410   opts->defOpt("f", "output-format", PgOpt::INT_OPT,
00411                      "Output format: [2|3|4] default= 4",
00412                      "4");
00413   //
00414   opts->defOpt("o","output",PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00415                      "The output file to generate.",
00416                      "");
00417   opts->defOpt("","extra-columns",PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00418                      "Add allele,context and channel columns.",
00419                      "true");
00420   //
00421   opts->defOpt("d","dump",PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00422                "Dump the probes to stdout.",
00423                "false");
00424   opts->defOpt("s","sort",PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00425                "Sort the probes by name before dumping.",
00426                "true");
00427   //
00428   opts->defOptMult("","merge-nonas",PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00429                    "The SPF files to merge onto both channels. (May be repeated.)",
00430                    "");
00431   opts->defOptMult("","merge-at",PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00432                    "The files to merge into the AT channel. (May be repeated.)",
00433                    "");
00434   opts->defOptMult("","merge-gc",PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00435                    "The files to merge into the GC channel.  (May be repeated.)",
00436                    "");
00437   //
00438   opts->defOpt("cpt","change-probe-type",PgOpt::INT_OPT,
00439                "Change the probe type.  (-1 means no change)",
00440                "-1");
00441   
00442 }
00443 
00444 int main(int argc, char *argv[]) {
00445   try {
00446     PgOptions *opts = NULL;
00447     opts = new PgOptions();
00448     define_apt_convert_spf_options(opts);
00449     opts->parseArgv(argv);
00450     
00451     int extra_columns;
00452     int output_format;
00453     std::string output_file;
00454     std::string arg;
00455     
00456     if(opts->getBool("help") || argc == 1) {
00457         opts->usage(true);
00458         return 0;
00459     }
00460     
00461     if (opts->getBool("dump")) {
00462         for (int i=0;i<opts->getArgCount();i++) {
00463         arg=opts->getArg(i);
00464         //
00465         ProbeListFactory* plf=new ProbeListFactory();
00466         plf->readSpfFile(arg);
00467         if (opts->getBool("sort-dump")) {
00468             plf->sortFactoryByName();
00469         }
00470         plf->dump();
00471         delete plf;
00472         }
00473         return 0;
00474     }
00475     
00476     extra_columns=opts->getBool("extra-columns")?1:0;
00477     output_format=opts->getInt("output-format");
00478     output_file=opts->get("output");
00479     
00480     // if any are set we are being asked to merge.
00481     if ((opts->get("merge-nonas")!="")||
00482         (opts->get("merge-at")!="") ||
00483         (opts->get("merge-gc")!="")) {
00484         //
00485         apt_falcon_merge(opts->mustFindOpt("merge-nonas")->getValueVector(),
00486                         opts->mustFindOpt("merge-at")->getValueVector(),
00487                         opts->mustFindOpt("merge-gc")->getValueVector(),
00488                         opts->getInt("change-probe-type"),
00489                         opts->getBool("sort"),
00490                         //
00491                         opts->get("output"));
00492         //
00493         return 0;
00494     }
00495     
00496     // a single file
00497     if (output_file!="") {
00498         if (opts->getArgCount()!=1) {
00499         APT_ERR_ABORT("Can only give one input arg when using --output.");
00500         }
00501         apt_convert_spf(opts->getArg(0),output_file,output_format,extra_columns);
00502         return 0;
00503     }
00504     
00505     if (opts->getArgCount()>0) {
00506         for (int i=0;i<opts->getArgCount();i++) {
00507         arg=opts->getArg(i);
00508         output_file=arg+"-v"+ToStr(output_format);
00509         //
00510         apt_convert_spf(arg,output_file,output_format,extra_columns);
00511         }
00512     }
00513     
00514     //
00515     printf("Need to give an input file.\n");
00516     opts->usage(true);
00517     return 0;
00518   } 
00519   catch(...) {
00520       Verbose::out(1,"Unexpected Error: uncaught exception.");
00521       return 1;
00522   }
00523   return 1;
00524 }
